name: Cumberland River Behavioral Health Inc.
description: Cumberland River Behavioral Health is a nonprofit community mental health center serving Southeastern Kentucky since 1966. The organization provides comprehensive mental health, substance abuse, and intellectual disability services across eight counties including Bell, Clay, Harlan, Jackson, Knox, Laurel, Rockcastle, and Whitley. Services include crisis intervention, outpatient counseling, psychiatric evaluation, medication management, and residential treatment programs.
source: Verified from official Cumberland River Behavioral Health website and Google search results
eligibility_requirements: Residents of Bell, Clay, Harlan, Jackson, Knox, Laurel, Rockcastle, and Whitley counties
cost_information: Payment based on ability to pay, accepts most insurance plans
notes: Crisis line available 24/7 at (800) 273-TALK or local crisis hub at 606-526-9552. Regional office located at 1203 American Greeting Rd., P.O. Box 568, Corbin, KY 40702. Main phone: 606-528-7010. Services include individual, group, and family counseling for mental health and substance abuse issues.
